definition[0]: to disobey or do something against an official agreement, law, principle etc
example[0]: Thirty-four protesters were arrested for violating criminal law.
definition[1]: to do something that makes someone feel that they have been attacked or have suffered a great loss of respect
example[2]: Victims of burglaries often feel personally violated.
example[3]: The media regularly violates people’s privacy.
definition[2]: to break open a grave, or force your way into a holy place without showing any respect
definition[3]: to force a woman to have sex
definition[4]: to disobey a law or do something that is against an official agreement, rule etc
example[5]: The contractors violated the law by laying off workers without notice.
example[6]: The proposed legislation would violate existing trade agreements.
definition[5]: to do something that does not respect someone’s rights, such as their right to be private
example[7]: There was concern that the company was violating customers’ privacy.
